de.rincewind.api.gui.windows.abstracts

Interface WindowActivatable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventBased, Modifyable, Window, WindowColorable, WindowContainer, WindowEditor, WindowNameable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    WindowBrewing, WindowFurnace
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftWindowActivatable, CraftWindowBrewing, CraftWindowFurnace, TestWindow2, Windows.WindowActivatableExtendable, Windows.WindowBrewingExtendable, Windows.WindowFurnaceExtendable

    public interface WindowActivatable
extends WindowColorable
    This window can be activated, for example the bubbles in the brewer or the flames in the furnace. To set the flames or the bubbles you have to use the progress of the windows. If the window is not opened, the progress will still be changed. The task will be stopped, if the window gets closed.
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    Rincewind34
    See Also:
    WindowFurnace, WindowBrewing

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if the task is running and false if not.
        Returns:
        true if the task is running and false if not

      • start

        void start(long delay)
        Starts the task with a specified delay between the changing of the progress. If the task already runs, this method will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        delay - specified

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the task. If the task is not running, this method will do nothing.

      • setProgress

        void setProgress(int progress)
        Sets the progress. If the task is running, the progress will still be set. If the progress is smaller than 0, the progress will be automatically set to 0.
        Parameters:
        progress - to set

      • getProgress

        int getProgress()
        Returns the currently set progress.
        Returns:
        the currently set progress
